term.title: ketyls

item.text: Radical anions (or the corresponding salts) derived from ketones by addition of an electron R2C.–O−R2C−–O..

notes.item: Ketyls produce two types of conjugate acids: R2C.–OH and R2CH–O.. The former are α-hydroxyalkyl radicals and the latter are alkoxyl radicals, but they have also been called ketyls in photochemistry.

sources.item: PAC, 1995, 67, 1307. 'Glossary of class names of organic compounds and reactivity intermediates based on structure (IUPAC Recommendations 1995)' on page 1346 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199567081307)

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
